ivardefs.name: carrierAIDC
ivardefs.desc: The full UDI carrier of the Automatic Identification and Data Capture (AIDC) technology representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device - E.g a barcode or RFID.   Because of limitations on character sets in XML and the need

ivardefs.name: carrierHRF
ivardefs.desc: The full UDI carrier as the human readable form (HRF) representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device.

ivardefs.name: deviceIdentifier
ivardefs.desc: The device identifier (DI) is a mandatory, fixed portion of a UDI that identifies the labeler and the specific version or model of a device.

ivardefs.name: entryType
ivardefs.desc: A coded entry to indicate how the data was entered.

ivardefs.name: issuer
ivardefs.desc:
Organization that is charged with issuing UDIs for devices.  For example, the US FDA issuers include :
1) GS1: 
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/gs1-di, 
2) HIBCC:
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/hibcc-dI, 
3) ICCBBA for blood containers:
http://hl7.org/

ivardefs.name: jurisdiction
ivardefs.desc: The identity of the authoritative source for UDI generation within a  jurisdiction.  All UDIs are globally unique within a single namespace. with the appropriate repository uri as the system.  For example,  UDIs of devices managed in the U.S. by the FDA,

ivardefs.name: name
ivardefs.desc: Name of device as used in labeling or catalog.

properties.desc: [Unique device identifier (UDI)](device.html#5.11.3.2.2) assigned to device label or package.
